name: Terminal Quotes
tagline: This program was written as a replacement for Linux Mint's "Fortune Cookies". It prints a quote every time the terminal is opened. More quotes can easily be added.
body:
Setup
-----
### Manual install (Linux)
Execute the following commands (just copy and paste):

    git clone git://github.com/haukurpallh/terminal-quotes.git
    mv terminal-quotes ~/.termquotes
    echo python /home/$USER/.termquotes/termquotes.py >> ~/.bashrc

Adding more quotes
------------------
The procedure to add quotes is fairly simple. For example, open `general.txt`
and enter the following lines:

    [William Shakespeare]
    To be or not to be: that is the question.

There can be no empty lines between the line containing the name of the author
and the quotes and there has to be an empty line between an author's last quote
and the next author's header ([William Shakespeare] in this case). Also, the
last line of the file has to be empty. Different quotes from the same author
are separated with `&` as in the following example:

    [William Shakespeare]
    Even you, Brutus?
    &
    To be or not to be: that is the question.

Usage
-----
Every time you open a new terminal the program will print a quote. If you
also want to be able to print a quote whenever you want, execute the following
command:

    echo alias q="python /home/$USER/.termquotes/termquotes.py >> ~/.baschrc"

Now enter the `q` command to get a random quote.

Coming soon
-----------
* Download quotes from various sites with one command.
* Improve code so that quotes with empty lines can be added.
* Layout settings and color.
* Automatic version checker.
